TITLE: Defining Giant in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: Definition of a Giant creature in Dwarf Fortress, including physical attributes, tissue details, and special abilities. Giants are semimegabeasts with humanoid characteristics, capable of learning, speaking, and causing destruction.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_standard.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: DF Raw
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:GIANT]
	[DESCRIPTION:A gigantic creature resembling a human, almost unparalleled in size.]
	[NAME:giant:giants:giant]
	[CREATURE_TILE:'G'][COLOR:3:0:0]
	[CREATURE_CLASS:MAMMAL]
	[FANCIFUL]
	[LARGE_PREDATOR]
	[SEMIMEGABEAST][DIFFICULTY:5]
		[ATTACK_TRIGGER:50:5000:50000]
	[CAN_LEARN][SLOW_LEARNER][CAN_SPEAK]
	[CANOPENDOORS]
	[BUILDINGDESTROYER:2]
	[PREFSTRING:height]
	[BIOME:ANY_LAND]
	[CURIOUSBEAST_EATER]
	[CURIOUSBEAST_GUZZLER]
	[CURIOUSBEAST_ITEM]
	[SPHERE:FOOD]
	[SPHERE:STRENGTH]
	[BODY:HUMANOID_NECK:2EYES:2EARS:NOSE:2LUNGS:HEART:GUTS:ORGANS:HUMANOID_JOINTS:THROAT:NECK:SPINE:BRAIN:SKULL:5FINGERS:5TOES:MOUTH:TONGUE:FACIAL_FEATURES:TEETH:RIBCAGE]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:STANDARD_MATERIALS]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:STANDARD_TISSUES]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:VERTEBRATE_TISSUE_LAYERS:SKIN:FAT:MUSCLE:BONE:CARTILAGE]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:HEAD_HAIR_TISSUE_LAYERS]
	[USE_TISSUE_TEMPLATE:EYEBROW:EYEBROW_TEMPLATE]
	[TISSUE_LAYER:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:EYEBROW:ABOVE:BY_CATEGORY:EYE]
	[USE_TISSUE_TEMPLATE:EYELASH:EYELASH_TEMPLATE]
	[TISSUE_LAYER:BY_CATEGORY:EYELID:EYELASH:FRONT]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:NAIL:NAIL_TEMPLATE]
	[USE_TISSUE_TEMPLATE:NAIL:NAIL_TEMPLATE]
	[TISSUE_LAYER:BY_CATEGORY:FINGER:NAIL:FRONT]
	[TISSUE_LAYER:BY_CATEGORY:TOE:NAIL:FRONT]
	[SELECT_TISSUE_LAYER:HEART:BY_CATEGORY:HEART]
	 [PLUS_TISSUE_LAYER:SKIN:BY_CATEGORY:THROAT]
		[TL_MAJOR_ARTERIES]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:FACIAL_HAIR_TISSUES]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:STANDARD_HEAD_POSITIONS]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:HUMANOID_HEAD_POSITIONS]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:HUMANOID_RIBCAGE_POSITIONS]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:HUMANOID_RELSIZES]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:SINEW:SINEW_TEMPLATE]
	[TENDONS:LOCAL_CREATURE_MAT:SINEW:200]
	[LIGAMENTS:LOCAL_CREATURE_MAT:SINEW:200]
	[HAS_NERVES]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:BLOOD:BLOOD_TEMPLATE]
	[BLOOD:LOCAL_CREATURE_MAT:BLOOD:LIQUID]
	[CREATURE_CLASS:GENERAL_POISON]
	[GETS_WOUND_INFECTIONS]
	[GETS_INFECTIONS_FROM_ROT]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:PUS:PUS_TEMPLATE]
	[PUS:LOCAL_CREATURE_MAT:PUS:LIQUID]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:SWEAT:SWEAT_TEMPLATE]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:TEARS:TEARS_TEMPLATE]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:SPIT:SPIT_TEMPLATE]
	[SECRETION:LOCAL_CREATURE_MAT:SWEAT:LIQUID:BY_CATEGORY:ALL:SKIN:EXERTION]
	[SECRETION:LOCAL_CREATURE_MAT:TEARS:LIQUID:BY_CATEGORY:EYE:ALL:EXTREME_EMOTION]
	[CAN_DO_INTERACTION:PET_ANIMAL]
		[CDI:ADV_NAME:Pet animal]
		[CDI:USAGE_HINT:GREETING]
		[CDI:BP_REQUIRED:BY_TYPE:GRASP]
		[CDI:VERB:pet:pets:pets]
		[CDI:TARGET:A:SELF_ONLY]
		[CDI:TARGET:B:TOUCHABLE]
		[CDI:TARGET_RANGE:B:1]
		[CDI:MAX_TARGET_NUMBER:B:1]
		[CDI:WAIT_PERIOD:20]
	[CAN_DO_INTERACTION:MATERIAL_EMISSION]
		[CDI:ADV_NAME:Spit]
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_standard.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_40

```
[CAN_LEARN]
	[CAN_SPEAK]
	[EQUIPS]
	[ALL_ACTIVE]
	[HOMEOTHERM:10067]
```

TITLE: Adding Necromancer Syndrome Interaction Effects
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the effects of a Necromancer syndrome, including adding tags like NO_AGING, NO_EAT, and NO_SLEEP. Most importantly, it adds the ability to perform interactions such as animating corpses and summoning bogeymen. It also defines the conditions and parameters for these interactions, like target range, verbs used, and wait periods.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/interaction_secret.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw Syntax
CODE:
```
"\t[I_EFFECT:ADD_SYNDROME]
\t\t[IE_TARGET:A]
\t\t[IE_IMMEDIATE]
\t\t[IE_ARENA_NAME:Necromancer]
\t\t[SYNDROME]
\t\t\t[CE_DISPLAY_TILE:TILE:165:5:0:1:START:0]
\t\t\t[CE_DISPLAY_NAME:NAME:necromancer:necromancers:necromantic:START:0]
\t\t\t[CE_ADD_TAG:NOEXERT:NO_AGING:NO_EAT:NO_DRINK:NO_SLEEP:NO_PHYS_ATT_GAIN:NO_PHYS_ATT_RUST:START:0]
\t\t\t[CE_CAN_DO_INTERACTION:START:0]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:ADV_NAME:Animate corpse]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:INTERACTION:EXAMPLE RAISE]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET:A:LINE_OF_SIGHT]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET_RANGE:A:10]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:VERB:gesture:gestures:NA]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET_VERB:shudder and begin to move:shudders and begins to move]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:WAIT_PERIOD:10]
\t\t\t[CE_CAN_DO_INTERACTION:START:0:ABRUPT]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:ADV_NAME:Raise faded hunter]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:INTERACTION:EXAMPLE UNDEAD LT RAISE]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET:A:LINE_OF_SIGHT]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET_RANGE:A:10]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:VERB:gesture:gestures:NA]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET_VERB:shudder and begin to move:shudders and begins to move]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:WAIT_PERIOD:10]
\t\t\t[CE_CAN_DO_INTERACTION:START:0:ABRUPT]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:ADV_NAME:Summon bogeymen]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:INTERACTION:EXAMPLE SUMMON]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:VERB:call upon the night:calls upon the night:NA]
\t\t\t\t[CDI:WAIT_PERIOD:100]"

```

TITLE: Defining Dragon Creature in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: Defines the dragon creature with its unique fire-breathing ability, body plan, and other characteristics. Includes details on its magical nature, longevity, and combat abilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_standard.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress creature definition syntax
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:DRAGON]
	[DESCRIPTION:A gigantic reptilian creature.  It is magical and can breathe fire.  These monsters can live for thousands of years.]
	[NAME:dragon:dragons:draconic]
	[CASTE_NAME:dragon:dragons:draconic]
	[CREATURE_TILE:'D'][COLOR:2:0:0]
	[PETVALUE:10000]
	[PET_EXOTIC]
	[TRAINABLE]
	[MOUNT_EXOTIC]
	[BIOME:ANY_LAND]
	[FREQUENCY:5]
	[CAN_DO_INTERACTION:MATERIAL_EMISSION]
		[CDI:ADV_NAME:Breathe fire]
		[CDI:USAGE_HINT:ATTACK]
		[CDI:BP_REQUIRED:BY_CATEGORY:MOUTH]
		[CDI:FLOW:DRAGONFIRE]
		[CDI:TARGET:C:LINE_OF_SIGHT]
		[CDI:TARGET_RANGE:C:15]
		[CDI:MAX_TARGET_NUMBER:C:1]
		[CDI:WAIT_PERIOD:50]
	[FIREIMMUNE_SUPER]
	[FANCIFUL]
	[LARGE_PREDATOR]
	[MEGABEAST][DIFFICULTY:10]
		[ATTACK_TRIGGER:80:10000:100000]
	[SPHERE:FIRE]
	[SPHERE:WEALTH]
	[CURIOUSBEAST_ITEM]
	[NOFEAR][NOEXERT]
	[BUILDINGDESTROYER:2]
	[GRASSTRAMPLE:50]
	[BONECARN]
	[PREFSTRING:terrible majesty]
	[BODY:QUADRUPED_NECK:TAIL:2EYES:NOSE:2LUNGS:HEART:GUTS:ORGANS:THROAT:NECK:SPINE:BRAIN:SKULL:4TOES_FQ_REG:4TOES_RQ_REG:MOUTH:TONGUE:GENERIC_TEETH_WITH_LARGE_EYE_TEETH:RIBCAGE]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:STANDARD_MATERIALS]
		[REMOVE_MATERIAL:SKIN]
		[REMOVE_MATERIAL:LEATHER]
		[REMOVE_MATERIAL:PARCHMENT]
		[REMOVE_MATERIAL:HAIR]
		[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:SCALE:SCALE_TEMPLATE]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:STANDARD_TISSUES]
		[REMOVE_TISSUE:SKIN]
		[REMOVE_TISSUE:HAIR]
		[USE_TISSUE_TEMPLATE:SCALE:SCALE_TEMPLATE]
	[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:VERTEBRATE_TISSUE_LAYERS:SCALE:FAT:MUSCLE:BONE:CARTILAGE]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:CLAW:NAIL_TEMPLATE]
	[USE_TISSUE_TEMPLATE:CLAW:CLAW_TEMPLATE]
	[TISSUE_LAYER:BY_CATEGORY:TOE:CLAW:FRONT]
```

[TEMPERATURE:YES]
[WEATHER:YES]
[ECONOMY:YES]
[INVADERS:YES]

TITLE: Defining Dwarf Creature Attributes – DFML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet initializes the Dwarf creature with its core attributes and properties, including its description, caste details, and body structure. Specific tags ensure consistency in the genetic and behavioral definitions of the creature.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_standard.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dfml
CODE:
```
[OBJECT:CREATURE]

[CREATURE:DWARF]
	[DESCRIPTION:A short, sturdy creature fond of drink and industry.]
	[NAME:dwarf:dwarves:dwarven]
	[CASTE_NAME:dwarf:dwarves:dwarven]
	[CREATURE_TILE:1][COLOR:3:0:0]
	[CREATURE_SOLDIER_TILE:2]
	[CREATURE_CLASS:MAMMAL]

	Many of the following tags are actually caste-level tags (in this case, male and female), but because there are no differences between the castes for these tags in a dwarf, you can add them earlier.  Any caste-level tag that occurs before castes are explicitly declared is saved up and placed on any caste that is declared later, unless the caste is explicitly derived from another caste.

	[INTELLIGENT]
	[STRANGE_MOODS]
	[TRANCES]
	[BENIGN]
	[CANOPENDOORS]
	[PREFSTRING:beards]
[BODY:HUMANOID_NECK:2EYES:2EARS:NOSE:2LUNGS:HEART:GUTS:ORGANS:HUMANOID_JOINTS:THROAT:NECK:SPINE:BRAIN:SKULL:5FINGERS:5TOES:MOUTH:TONGUE:FACIAL_FEATURES:TEETH:RIBCAGE]
```

TITLE: Defining an Item Instrument with Parts in Dwarf Fortress RAW
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines an item instrument, "EXAMPLE DRUM", composed of two parts: a drum body and a drum head. It specifies properties like name, value, size, dominant material, and instrument pieces.  It further defines sound production method, pitch choice, tuning, pitch range, timbre, registers, required music skill, and a description for the instrument.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/examples and notes/item_instrument_example.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: raw
CODE:
```
"[ITEM_INSTRUMENT:EXAMPLE DRUM]
[NAME:thokit:thokit]
[VALUE:50]
[SIZE:23000]
	Add PLACED_AS_BUILDING as a stand-alone tag if you want a stationary instrument.
[DOMINANT_MATERIAL_PIECE:BODY]
[INSTRUMENT_PIECE:BODY:EXAMPLE DRUM BODY:drum:drums:STANDARD]
	Format is <token>:<tool token>:<singular>:<plural>:<STANDARD or ALWAYS_PLURAL or ALWAYS_SINGULAR>

[INSTRUMENT_PIECE:HEAD:EXAMPLE DRUM HEAD:head:heads:STANDARD]
[VOLUME_mB:0:10000]

[SOUND_PRODUCTION:STRUCK_BY_BP:HEAD]
	Sound production methods are: PLUCKED_BY_BP, PLUCKED (requires two tokens, actor then target), BOWED (two tokens), STRUCK_BY_BP, STRUCK (two tokens), VIBRATE_BP_AGAINST_OPENING, BLOW_AGAINST_FIPPLE, BLOW_OVER_OPENING_SIDE, BLOW_OVER_OPENING_END, BLOW_OVER_SINGLE_REED, BLOW_OVER_DOUBLE_REED, BLOW_OVER_FREE_REED, STRUCK_TOGETHER, SHAKEN, SCRAPED (two tokens), FRICTION (two tokens), RESONATOR, BAG_OVER_REED (two tokens), AIR_OVER_REED (two tokens, AIR_OVER_FREE_REED (two tokens) and AIR_AGAINST_FIPPLE (two tokens).
	You can use this tag multiple times.

[PITCH_CHOICE:MEMBRANE_POSITION:HEAD]
	Pitch choice methods are MEMBRANE_POSITION, SUBPART_CHOICE, KEYBOARD, STOPPING_FRET (requires two tokens, first for \"string\" second for \"neck\" -- or whatever is being pressed against what), STOPPING_AGAINST_BODY (two tokens), STOPPING_HOLE, STOPPING_HOLE_KEY, SLIDE, HARMONIC_SERIES, VALVE_ROUTES_AIR, BP_IN_BELL and FOOT_PEDALS (two token, first is what is being changed e.g. \"strings\", second is \"body\" which has pedalboard -- or whatever piece is being stepped on).
	You can use this tag multiple times.

[TUNING:TIGHTENING:HEAD]
	Tuning methods are PEGS, ADJUSTABLE_BRIDGES, CROOKS, TIGHTENING and LEVERS.
	You can use this tag multiple times.

[PITCH_RANGE:1020:3020]
	Pitch is <min>:<max> in cents with middle C at zero.  There are 1200 cents in an octave.  The game verbally differentiates values from -4200 to 4200, but you can go outside that if you like.  The in-game generated instruments will range from roughly C0 to C8 (-4800 to 4800), sometimes beyond for really unusual ones.
	You can also use INDEFINITE_PITCH.

[TIMBRE:FULL:CHOPPY:FOCUSED]
	You can add as many timbre words as you want.  The generated timbres have a series of checks for conflicts, but they don't apply to the raws, so how you use them is up to you.  The current timbres are CLEAR, NOISY, FULL, THIN, ROUND, SHARP, SMOOTH, CHOPPY, STEADY, EVOLVING, STRONG, DELICATE, BRIGHT, GRACEFUL, SPARSE, BREATHY, STRAINED, BROAD, LIGHT, MELLOW, WOBBLING, FOCUSED, EVEN, FLUID, VIBRATING, QUAVERING, EERIE, FRAGILE, BRITTLE, PURE, PIERCING, STRIDENT, WAVERING, HARSH, REEDY, NASAL, BUZZY, ROUGH, WARM, RUGGED, HEAVY, FLAT, DARK, CRISP, SONOROUS, WATERY, GENTLE, SLICING, LIQUID, RAUCOUS, BREEZY, RASPY, WISPY, SHRILL, MUDDY, RICH, DULL, FLOATING, RINGING, RESONANT, SWEET, RIPPLING and SPARKLING.

[REGISTER:1020:1320:STRONG:VIBRATING:STRIDENT]
	Registers also have a min/max pitch range.  The timbres here are in addition to the global timbre, so don't assign a global timbre unless you feel it is compatible with each register.

[REGISTER:1320:3020:VIBRATING:RAUCOUS]
[MUSIC_SKILL:PLAY_PERCUSSION_INSTRUMENT]
[DESCRIPTION:The thokit is a mid-size hand-held percussion instrument.  It consists of an hourglass bone drum with a leather head.  The musician strikes the head.  The instrument has a one-and-a-half octave range going from a mid-high to a very high pitch.  Tuning is accomplished by adjusting the tension of the head.  At all pitches, the instrument has a full choppy focused timbre.  It has two registers.  The low register has a strong vibrating strident timbre.  The high register begins at mid-high pitch and has a vibrating raucous timbre.]
```

TITLE: Configuring Elf Physical Attributes and Body Structure
DESCRIPTION: Detailed specification of the Elf's physical structure including body parts, tissues, and materials that make up their form.

TITLE: Disturbance Interaction Definition
DESCRIPTION: Defines an interaction that triggers upon a disturbance, targeting a corpse. It resurrects the corpse and applies a 'DISTURBANCE_CURSE' syndrome, transforming it into a mummy-like creature. The resurrected creature gains various attributes and abilities like increased strength and toughness while losing others.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/interaction_disturbance.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw
CODE:
```
"[INTERACTION:EXAMPLE DISTURBANCE EFFECT]\n\t[I_SOURCE:DISTURBANCE]\n\t[I_TARGET:A:CORPSE]\n\t\t[IT_LOCATION:CONTEXT_ITEM]\n\t\t[IT_FORBIDDEN:NOT_LIVING]\n\t\t[IT_REQUIRES:CAN_SPEAK]\n\t\t[IT_REQUIRES:FIT_FOR_RESURRECTION]\n\t\t[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:WERECURSE]\n\t\t[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:VAMPCURSE]\n\t\t[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:DISTURBANCE_CURSE]\n\t[I_EFFECT:RESURRECT]\n\t\t[IE_TARGET:A]\n\t\t[IE_IMMEDIATE]\n\t\t[IE_ARENA_NAME:Disturbed dead]\n\t\t[SYNDROME]\n\t\t\t[SYN_CLASS:DISTURBANCE_CURSE]\n\t\t\t[CE_DISPLAY_TILE:TILE:165:6:0:1:START:0]\n\t\t\t[CE_DISPLAY_NAME:NAME:mummy:mummies:mummified:START:0]\n\t\t\t[CE_PHYS_ATT_CHANGE:STRENGTH:300:1000:TOUGHNESS:300:1000:START:0]\n[CE_ADD_TAG:NO_AGING:NOT_LIVING:OPPOSED_TO_LIFE:STERILE:EXTRAVISION:NOEXERT:NOPAIN:NOBREATHE:NOSTUN:NONAUSEA:NO_DIZZINESS:NO_FEVERS:NOEMOTION:PARALYZEIMMUNE:NOFEAR:NO_EAT:NO_DRINK:NO_SLEEP:NO_PHYS_ATT_GAIN:NO_PHYS_ATT_RUST:NOTHOUGHT:NO_THOUGHT_CENTER_FOR_MOVEMENT:NO_CONNECTIONS_FOR_MOVEMENT:START:0]\n\t\t\t[CE_REMOVE_TAG:HAS_BLOOD:TRANCES:LIKES_FIGHTING:MISCHIEVOUS:START:0]\n\t\t\t[CE_CAN_DO_INTERACTION:START:0]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:ADV_NAME:Curse]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:INTERACTION:EXAMPLE CURSE]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET:A:LINE_OF_SIGHT:DISTURBER_ONLY]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET_RANGE:A:25]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:USAGE_HINT:MAJOR_CURSE]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:VERBAL]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:VERBAL_SPEECH:curse.txt]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:MAX_TARGET_NUMBER:A:1]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET_VERB:feel horrible:looks horrible]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:WAIT_PERIOD:20]\n\t\t\t[CE_CAN_DO_INTERACTION:START:0]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:ADV_NAME:Animate corpse]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:INTERACTION:EXAMPLE D RAISE]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET:A:LINE_OF_SIGHT]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET_RANGE:A:25]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:VERB:gesture:gestures:NA]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:TARGET_VERB:shudder and begin to move:shudders and begins to move]\n\t\t\t\t[CDI:WAIT_PERIOD:10]"

TITLE: Defining Basic One-Part Body Structure in RAW
DESCRIPTION: Defines a basic body structure with one major body part, typically used for simple creatures or those without complex anatomy. Specifies categories and relative sizes for modular ease. No external dependencies are required as it is a structure definition file. The main input is the creature body configuration, and it does not produce direct outputs but defines how creatures are structured in the simulation. These body parts have no real-world measurement units, as the sizes are relative within the simulation constraints.

[BODY:BASIC_1PARTBODY]

```

LANGUAGE: raw
CODE:
```

TITLE: Define Animate Corpse Interaction in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This interaction defines the process of animating a corpse in Dwarf Fortress. It specifies that the target must be a corpse in the context item, affected by general poison, fit for animation, and not alive. The effect of the interaction is to animate the corpse, causing it to gain strength, toughness, and speed, and adding tags like NO_AGING and NOT_LIVING.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/interaction_secret.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw Syntax
CODE:
```
"[INTERACTION:EXAMPLE RAISE]
\t[I_TARGET:A:CORPSE]
\t\t[IT_LOCATION:CONTEXT_ITEM]
\t\t[IT_AFFECTED_CLASS:GENERAL_POISON]
\t\t[IT_REQUIRES:FIT_FOR_ANIMATION]
\t\t[IT_FORBIDDEN:NOT_LIVING]
\t\t[IT_MANUAL_INPUT:corpses]
\t[I_EFFECT:ANIMATE]
\t\t[IE_TARGET:A]
\t\t[IE_IMMEDIATE]
\t\t[IE_ARENA_NAME:Animated corpse]
\t\t[SYNDROME]
\t\t\t[CE_FLASH_TILE:TILE:165:3:0:0:FREQUENCY:2000:1000:START:0]
\t\t\t[CE_PHYS_ATT_CHANGE:STRENGTH:300:1000:TOUGHNESS:300:1000:START:0]
\t\t\t[CE_SPEED_CHANGE:SPEED_PERC:60:START:0]
[CE_ADD_TAG:NO_AGING:NOT_LIVING:OPPOSED_TO_LIFE:EXTRAVISION:NOEXERT:NOPAIN:NOBREATHE:NOSTUN:NONAUSEA:NO_DIZZINESS:NO_FEVERS:NOEMOTION:PARALYZEIMMUNE:NOFEAR:NO_EAT:NO_DRINK:NO_SLEEP:NO_PHYS_ATT_GAIN:NO_PHYS_ATT_RUST:NOTHOUGHT:NO_THOUGHT_CENTER_FOR_MOVEMENT:NO_CONNECTIONS_FOR_MOVEMENT:START:0]
\t\t\t[CE_REMOVE_TAG:HAS_BLOOD:TRANCES:LIKES_FIGHTING:MISCHIEVOUS:START:0]"

```

TITLE: Applying Creature Variations in Modding
DESCRIPTION: This section provides a series of commands for removing, converting, and adding tags to define creature variations like 'ANIMAL_PERSON' and 'ANIMAL_PERSON_LEGLESS' in Dwarf Fortress. It includes dependencies such as APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION and relies on conditional conversions using input arguments (!ARG1, !ARG2, etc.) to fine-tune creature transformations. The tags manage various creature attributes, from names and descriptions to physical and behavioral traits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/c_variation_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:ANIMAL_PERSON]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:NAME]
...
```

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
[CREATURE_VARIATION:ANIMAL_PERSON_LEGLESS]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:NAME]
...
```

TITLE: Defining Werebeast Curse Interaction
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the interaction for the werebeast curse, specifying its source as a deity, its requirements, and the effect it has on the target creature. This effect transforms the creature during the full moon.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/interaction_werebeast.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dwarf fortress interaction definition
CODE:
```
[INTERACTION:WEREBEAST_CURSE]

[I_SOURCE:DEITY]
	[IS_USAGE_HINT:MAJOR_CURSE]
	[IS_HIST_STRING_1: cursed ]
	[IS_HIST_STRING_2: to assume the form of a wolf-like monster every full moon]

[I_TARGET:A:CREATURE]
	[IT_LOCATION:CONTEXT_CREATURE]
	[IT_REQUIRES:CAN_LEARN]
	[IT_REQUIRES:HAS_BLOOD]
	[IT_FORBIDDEN:NOT_LIVING]
	[IT_FORBIDDEN:SUPERNATURAL]
	[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:WERECURSE]
	[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:VAMPCURSE]
	[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:DISTURBANCE_CURSE]

[I_EFFECT:ADD_SYNDROME]
	[IE_TARGET:A]
	[IE_IMMEDIATE]
	[SYNDROME]
	[IE_ARENA_NAME:Werewolf]
	[SYN_CLASS:WERECURSE]
	[CE_BODY_TRANSFORMATION:START:0]
		[CE:CREATURE:WEREBEAST:DEFAULT]
		[CE:PERIODIC:MOON_PHASE:27:0]
		[CE_ADD_TAG:NO_AGING:START:0]
```

The `[BUILD_ITEM]` tags specify the types and quantities of materials needed to construct the workshop, along with flags like `[CAN_USE_ARTIFACT]`.

TITLE: Defining a Basic Toad Creature in Dwarf Fortress

It also defines attack parameters like bite and its movement gaits, including walking, crawling, and swimming. This base template is subsequently used to define the Toad Man and Giant Toad creatures.

	[DESCRIPTION:A squat amphibian with leathery skin, found in relatively dry areas.]
	[NAME:toad:toads:toad]
	[CASTE_NAME:toad:toads:toad]
	[CREATURE_TILE:249][COLOR:2:0:0]
	[PETVALUE:10]
	[VERMIN_GROUNDER][FREQUENCY:100][VERMIN_HATEABLE]
	[AMPHIBIOUS][SMALL_REMAINS][NO_WINTER][UNDERSWIM]

	[GETS_INFECTIONS_FROM_ROT]

TITLE: Defining Healing Blessing Interaction in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a healing blessing interaction in Dwarf Fortress. It specifies the source as a deity and defines the target as a creature. The effect of the interaction is to add a syndrome that stops bleeding, closes wounds, heals tissues and nerves, reduces pain, swelling, paralysis, dizziness, nausea, fever, and regrows parts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/example - shrine effects.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw
CODE:
```
"[INTERACTION:HEALING_BLESSING]\n\t[I_SOURCE:DEITY]\n\t	[IS_USAGE_HINT:MEDIUM_BLESSING]\n\t	[IS_TRIGGER_STRING_SECOND:have]\n\t	[IS_TRIGGER_STRING_THIRD:has]\n\t	[IS_TRIGGER_STRING:been granted healing!]\n\t[I_TARGET:A:CREATURE]\n\t	[IT_LOCATION:CONTEXT_CREATURE]\n\t	[IT_MANUAL_INPUT:recipient]\n\t[I_EFFECT:ADD_SYNDROME]\n\t	[IE_TARGET:A]\n\t	[IE_IMMEDIATE]\n\t	[SYNDROME]\n\t		[SYN_CONCENTRATION_ADDED:1000:0]\n\t		[CE_STOP_BLEEDING:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_CLOSE_OPEN_WOUNDS:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_HEAL_TISSUES:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_HEAL_NERVES:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_REDUCE_PAIN:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_REDUCE_SWELLING:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_CURE_INFECTION:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_REDUCE_PARALYSIS:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_REDUCE_DIZZINESS:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_REDUCE_NAUSEA:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_REDUCE_FEVER:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]\n\t		[CE_REGROW_PARTS:SEV:100:PROB:100:START:0:PEAK:0:END:12:ABRUPT]"
```

TITLE: Defining Lion Creature in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a "Lion" creature in Dwarf Fortress, setting its description, name, caste name, and child name. It specifies its tile representation, creature class, pet and mount status, trainability, biome preferences, roaming behavior, population and cluster numbers, dietary habits, and trampling behavior. It also defines its body structure, material templates, tissue layers, tendons, ligaments, nerves, blood properties, infection vulnerabilities, pus properties, body sizes, appearance modifiers, and maximum age. Finally, it configures its attacks (bite and scratch), diurnal behavior, homeotherm temperature, and gaits. Defines some caste based traits and color modifiers.

TITLE: Define Resurrect Unit Interaction in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This interaction defines the process of resurrecting a corpse in Dwarf Fortress as an undead faded hunter. It includes various conditions the corpse must meet, such as being fit for resurrection and not belonging to specific syndrome classes (WERECURSE, VAMPCURSE, etc.). The interaction resurrects the corpse and applies a syndrome that alters its attributes and adds new abilities like Propel away and Raise fog.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/interaction_secret.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

TITLE: Adding new reaction tags in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases the addition of new reaction tags in Dwarf Fortress, enhancing the customization of reactions.  These tags include options for disabling improvements, preventing absorption, specifying product types, and controlling product amounts. The tags `CONTAINS` allows defining container contents within reactions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/file changes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
	new reaction tags
		[NOT_IMPROVED]
		[DOES_NOT_ABSORB]
		[PRODUCT_PASTE]
		[PRODUCT_PRESSED]
		[NOT_PRESSED]
		[DOES_NOT_DETERMINE_PRODUCT_AMOUNT]
		[CONTAINS:<reagent token>]
			not respected in adv mode interface, didn't try nesting containers
			multiple CONTAINS on one reagent supported if they don't overlap
```

TITLE: Corpse Animation Interaction
DESCRIPTION: Defines an interaction to animate a corpse. It targets a corpse and applies a syndrome that changes physical attributes and adds tags to the animated creature. This includes increased strength and toughness, alongside tags like NO_AGING and OPPOSED_TO_LIFE, while removing tags such as HAS_BLOOD and LIKES_FIGHTING.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/interaction_disturbance.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw
CODE:
```
"[INTERACTION:EXAMPLE D RAISE]\n\t[I_TARGET:A:CORPSE]\n\t\t[IT_LOCATION:CONTEXT_ITEM]\n\t\t[IT_AFFECTED_CLASS:GENERAL_POISON]\n\t\t[IT_REQUIRES:FIT_FOR_ANIMATION]\n\t\t[IT_FORBIDDEN:NOT_LIVING]\n\t\t[IT_MANUAL_INPUT:corpses]\n\t[I_EFFECT:ANIMATE]\n\t\t[IE_TARGET:A]\n\t\t[IE_IMMEDIATE]\n\t\t[IE_ARENA_NAME:Animated corpse]\n\t\t[SYNDROME]\n\t\t\t[CE_FLASH_TILE:TILE:165:3:0:0:FREQUENCY:2000:1000:START:0]\n\t\t\t[CE_PHYS_ATT_CHANGE:STRENGTH:300:1000:TOUGHNESS:300:1000:START:0]\n\t\t\t[CE_SPEED_CHANGE:SPEED_PERC:60:START:0]\n[CE_ADD_TAG:NO_AGING:NOT_LIVING:OPPOSED_TO_LIFE:EXTRAVISION:NOEXERT:NOPAIN:NOBREATHE:NOSTUN:NONAUSEA:NO_DIZZINESS:NO_FEVERS:NOEMOTION:PARALYZEIMMUNE:NOFEAR:NO_EAT:NO_DRINK:NO_SLEEP:NO_PHYS_ATT_GAIN:NO_PHYS_ATT_RUST:NOTHOUGHT:NO_THOUGHT_CENTER_FOR_MOVEMENT:NO_CONNECTIONS_FOR_MOVEMENT:START:0]\n\t\t\t[CE_REMOVE_TAG:HAS_BLOOD:TRANCES:LIKES_FIGHTING:MISCHIEVOUS:START:0]"
```

```

[SIZE:1200]
[SKILL:AXE]
[TWO_HANDED:77500]
[MINIMUM_SIZE:62500]
[MATERIAL_SIZE:5]

	[ATTACK_PREPARE_AND_RECOVER:3:3]

	[ATTACK_PREPARE_AND_RECOVER:3:3]

TITLE: Defining Lion Man Creature in Dwarf Fortress

TITLE: Defining Pet Blessing Interaction in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a pet blessing interaction, summoning a creature to become a pet. It defines the source as deity, and the target is a location. The effect summons a unit to a nearby location, forbidding certain creature types and castes while also filtering for large predators and natural animals. The interaction attempts to make the summoned creature a pet.

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw

The definition includes information about its behavior, physical characteristics, and combat abilities, with a note that it needs to be made out of ice.

[CREATURE:BLIZZARD_MAN]
	[DESCRIPTION:A large humanoid monster from the wild tundra.  It has translucent skin, icicles for teeth, red glowing eyes and pointed ears.]
	[NAME:blizzard man:blizzard men:blizzard man]
	[CASTE_NAME:blizzard man:blizzard men:blizzard man]
	[CREATURE_TILE:'M'][COLOR:3:0:1]
	[GLOWTILE:'"'][GLOWCOLOR:4:0:1]

	[PREFSTRING:translucent skin]

	[BODY:HUMANOID_NECK:2EYES:2EARS:NOSE:HUMANOID_JOINTS:5FINGERS:5TOES:MOUTH:TONGUE:FACIAL_FEATURES:TEETH]

SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/item_shield.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: raws
CODE:
```
[ITEM_SHIELD:ITEM_SHIELD_BUCKLER]
[NAME:buckler:bucklers]
[ARMORLEVEL:1]
[BLOCKCHANCE:10]
[UPSTEP:1]
[MATERIAL_SIZE:2]
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/plant_crops.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raws
CODE:
```
[PLANT:KENAF] Hibiscus cannabinus
	[NAME:kenaf plant][NAME_PLURAL:kenaf plants][ADJ:kenaf plant]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:STRUCTURAL:STRUCTURAL_PLANT_TEMPLATE]
		[MATERIAL_REACTION_PRODUCT:PRESS_PAPER_MAT:LOCAL_PLANT_MAT:THREAD]
		[MATERIAL_REACTION_PRODUCT:SEED_MAT:LOCAL_PLANT_MAT:SEED]
	[BASIC_MAT:LOCAL_PLANT_MAT:STRUCTURAL]
	[DRY][BIOME:ANY_TROPICAL]
	[VALUE:2]
	[SPRING][SUMMER][AUTUMN][WINTER]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:OIL:PLANT_OIL_TEMPLATE]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:ALL_SOLID:frozen kenaf seed oil]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:LIQUID:kenaf seed oil]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:GAS:boiling kenaf seed oil]
		[PREFIX:NONE]
		[MATERIAL_VALUE:5]
		[EDIBLE_COOKED]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:SOAP:PLANT_SOAP_TEMPLATE]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:ALL_SOLID:kenaf seed oil soap]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:LIQUID:melted kenaf seed oil soap]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:GAS:n/a]
		[PREFIX:NONE]
		[MATERIAL_VALUE:5]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:LEAF:LEAF_TEMPLATE]
		[STATE_COLOR:ALL:GREEN]
		[DISPLAY_COLOR:2:0:0]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:FLOWER:FLOWER_TEMPLATE]
		[STATE_COLOR:ALL_SOLID:WHITE]
		[DISPLAY_COLOR:7:0:1]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:SEED:SEED_TEMPLATE]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:ALL_SOLID:kenaf seed]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:SOLID_PASTE:kenaf seed paste]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:SOLID_PRESSED:kenaf seed press cake]
		[MATERIAL_VALUE:1]
		[EDIBLE_VERMIN]
		[EDIBLE_RAW]
		[EDIBLE_COOKED]
		[MATERIAL_REACTION_PRODUCT:PRESS_LIQUID_MAT:LOCAL_PLANT_MAT:OIL]
		[PREFIX:NONE]
		[STOCKPILE_GLOB_PASTE]
		[STOCKPILE_GLOB_PRESSED]
	[SEED:kenaf seed:kenaf seeds:0:0:1:LOCAL_PLANT_MAT:SEED]
	[FREQUENCY:50]
	[CLUSTERSIZE:5]
	[PREFSTRING:flowers]
	[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:THREAD:THREAD_PLANT_TEMPLATE] *** fiber from stems
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:SOLID:kenaf]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:SOLID_PASTE:kenaf slurry]
		[STATE_NAME_ADJ:SOLID_PRESSED:kenaf paper]
		[PREFIX:NONE]
		[MATERIAL_VALUE:2]
		[REACTION_CLASS:PAPER_SLURRY]
		[STOCKPILE_GLOB_PASTE]
	[THREAD:LOCAL_PLANT_MAT:THREAD]
	[GROWTH:LEAVES]
		[GROWTH_NAME:kenaf leaf:kenaf leaves]
		[GROWTH_ITEM:PLANT_GROWTH:NONE:LOCAL_PLANT_MAT:LEAF]
		[GROWTH_DENSITY:1000]
		[GROWTH_PRINT:0:6:2:0:0:ALL:1]
	[GROWTH:FLOWERS]
		[GROWTH_NAME:kenaf flower:STP]
		[GROWTH_ITEM:PLANT_GROWTH:NONE:LOCAL_PLANT_MAT:FLOWER]
		[GROWTH_DENSITY:1000]
		[GROWTH_TIMING:60000:119999]
		[GROWTH_PRINT:5:5:7:0:1:60000:119999:2]
```

TITLE: Defining Giant Two-Humped Camel Species in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: Complete creature definition for the giant two-humped camel, a larger variant of the normal camel. Includes physical attributes, movement speeds, appearance, and population parameters with an 811% increase in body size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_large_tropical.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_50

LANGUAGE: dwarf-fortress-raws
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:GIANT_CAMEL_2_HUMP]
	[COPY_TAGS_FROM:CAMEL_2_HUMP]
	[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:GIANT]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC]
	[APPLY_CURRENT_CREATURE_VARIATION]
	[GO_TO_END]
	[SELECT_CASTE:ALL]
	[CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC:811]
	[GO_TO_START]
	[NAME:giant two-humped camel:giant two-humped camels:giant two-humped camel]
	[CASTE_NAME:giant two-humped camel:giant two-humped camels:giant two-humped camel]
	[GENERAL_CHILD_NAME:giant two-humped camel calf:giant two-humped camel calves]
	[DESCRIPTION:A huge monster the shape of a two-humped camel.]
	[POPULATION_NUMBER:15:30]
	[CLUSTER_NUMBER:3:7]
	[CREATURE_TILE:'C']
	[COLOR:6:0:0]
	[PET_EXOTIC]
	[PETVALUE:500]
	[MOUNT_EXOTIC]
	[GO_TO_END]
	[PREFSTRING:hump]
	[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_QUADRUPED_GAITS:900:405:270:135:1900:2900] 65 kph
	[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_SWIMMING_GAITS:9000:8900:8825:8775:9500:9900] 1 kph
	[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_CRAWLING_GAITS:9000:8900:8825:8775:9500:9900] 1 kph
```

TITLE: Small Island World Generation Parameters
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for generating a 65x65 small island world with specific parameters for elevation, rainfall, temperature, and various supernatural elements. Includes settings for civilizations, beasts, and geographical features.

LANGUAGE: dwarf-fortress-config
CODE:
```
[WORLD_GEN]
	[TITLE:SMALL ISLAND]
	[DIM:65:65]
	[EMBARK_POINTS:1504]
	[END_YEAR:1050]
	[BEAST_END_YEAR:100:80]

```

TITLE: Defining Inorganic Peat in DF Modding
DESCRIPTION: Peat, defined here with a density of 850, is assumed to contain some water. It includes parameters defining its solid state name and adjective, display color, visibility tile, and aquifer properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/inorganic_stone_soil.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: DF Modding
CODE:
```
[INORGANIC:PEAT]
[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:SOIL_TEMPLATE]
[STATE_NAME_ADJ:ALL_SOLID:peat][DISPLAY_COLOR:0:6:1][TILE:176]
[SOIL][AQUIFER]
[SOLID_DENSITY:850]  Peat was much too high.  This assumes it has some water in it.
```

TITLE: Defining Werebeast Bite Interaction
DESCRIPTION: This snippet outlines the interaction for the werebeast bite, detailing its source as an attack and the conditions under which it can pass the werebeast curse to another creature.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/interaction_werebeast.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dwarf fortress interaction definition
CODE:
```
[INTERACTION:WEREBEAST_BITE]

[I_SOURCE:ATTACK]
	[IS_HIST_STRING_1: bit ]
	[IS_HIST_STRING_2:, passing on the werebeast curse]

[I_TARGET:A:CREATURE]
	[IT_LOCATION:CONTEXT_CREATURE]
	[IT_REQUIRES:CAN_LEARN]
	[IT_REQUIRES:HAS_BLOOD]
	[IT_FORBIDDEN:NOT_LIVING]
	[IT_FORBIDDEN:SUPERNATURAL]
	[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:WERECURSE]
	[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:VAMPCURSE]
	[IT_CANNOT_HAVE_SYNDROME_CLASS:DISTURBANCE_CURSE]

[I_EFFECT:ADD_SYNDROME]
	[IE_TARGET:A]
	[IE_IMMEDIATE]
	[SYNDROME]
	[SYN_CLASS:WERECURSE]
	[CE_BODY_TRANSFORMATION:START:16800]
		[CE:CREATURE:WEREBEAST:DEFAULT]
		[CE:PERIODIC:MOON_PHASE:27:0]
```

TITLE: Defining Graphics Tile Page and Creature Graphics in DFScript
DESCRIPTION: This DFScript code snippet defines a graphics tile page and assigns specific graphical representations to Dwarves in Dwarf Fortress. It specifies the bitmap file to be used, dimensions of tiles on the page, and how different profession-specific sprites should be aligned and colored. There are no external dependencies beyond the specified bitmap file and existing tokens in the game's modding framework.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/graphics/graphics_example.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: DFScript
CODE:
```
[OBJECT:GRAPHICS]

[TILE_PAGE:DWARVES]
	[FILE:example/dwarves.bmp]
	[TILE_DIM:16:16]
	[PAGE_DIM:3:1]

[CREATURE_GRAPHICS:DWARF]
	[DEFAULT:DWARVES:0:0:ADD_COLOR]
	[MINER:DWARVES:1:0:AS_IS:DEFAULT]

	Custom position example:

	[MANAGER:DWARVES:2:0:AS_IS:DEFAULT]
```

TITLE: Adding new creature tags in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases the addition of new creature tags in Dwarf Fortress, expanding the capabilities for defining creature behavior and characteristics.  These tags include options for description adjustments, shearing properties, egg-laying, grazing habits, hive interaction, vermin interaction, and ubiquity.  These changes affect how creatures interact within the game world.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/file changes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
	new creature tags
		[APP_MOD_DESC_RANGE:<6 range numbers>] -- adjusts the numeric ranges for getting different adjectives in descriptions
		[SHEARABLE_TISSUE_LAYER:<body part modifier like LENGTH>:<modifier level when ready>]
		[LAYS_EGGS]
		[EGG_MATERIAL:<mat tokens>]
		[LAYS_UNUSUAL_EGGS:<item tokens>]
		[EGG_SIZE:<size>]
		[CLUTCH_SIZE:<min>:<max>]
		[GRAZER:<amount of hunger removed per bite>] -- only grazer animals in your fort need to eat at this point
		[ARTIFICIAL_HIVEABLE]
		[HIVE_PRODUCT:<max in hive>:<timer>:<item/mat tags>]
		[COLONY_EXTERNAL] -- this caste appears around the colony
		[DIE_WHEN_VERMIN_BITE]
		[REMAINS_ON_VERMIN_BITE_DEATH]
		[UBIQUITOUS] -- creature will occur in absolutely every region that is a biome match (does not apply to evil/good)
```

TITLE: Defining an Item Instrument without Parts in Dwarf Fortress RAW
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines an item instrument, "EXAMPLE WIND", without separate parts. It sets properties like name, value, size, material, and sound production, where "SELF" is used to indicate that the action applies to the instrument itself.  It also configures pitch choice, volume, pitch range, timbre, required music skill, and provides a descriptive text.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/examples and notes/item_instrument_example.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: raw
CODE:
```
[ITEM_INSTRUMENT:EXAMPLE WIND]
[NAME:ecosh:ecosh]
[VALUE:50]
[SIZE:25000]
[MATERIAL_SIZE:3]
[WOOD_MAT]
[SOUND_PRODUCTION:BLOW_OVER_OPENING_END:SELF]
	If the instrument has no parts, use SELF for the piece tokens.
[PITCH_CHOICE:SUBPART_CHOICE:SELF]
[VOLUME_mB:0:10000]
[PITCH_RANGE:-1200:3000]
[TIMBRE:SPARSE:WOBBLING:QUAVERING]
[MUSIC_SKILL:PLAY_WIND_INSTRUMENT]
[DESCRIPTION:The ecosh is a mid-size hand-held wind instrument consisting of three adjacent cylindrical wooden pipes.  The musician blows across the end of each pipe.  The instrument has a three-and-a-half octave range going from a mid-low to a very high pitch.  The instrument has a sparse wobbling quavering timbre.]
```

TITLE: Listing Book Title Templates for Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet contains a comprehensive list of book title templates used in Dwarf Fortress. These templates use placeholders like [NAME], [NO_ART_NAME], and [ANY_AGE] which are replaced with specific topics or subjects during the game's procedural book title generation process. The templates cover a wide range of styles, from academic works to personal reflections and historical accounts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/text/book_instruction.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```

TITLE: Defining Interaction Mechanics in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to define various interactions for creatures, enabling behaviors such as cleaning, emotional tags, and combat-related actions based on predefined interaction tokens. It lays out the structure for creating interaction capabilities in the game.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/file changes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
[CAN_DO_INTERACTION:<token>] -- this includes cleaning, ink spray, and physical social stuff
				[CLEANING] taken from cat
					[CDI:ADV_NAME:Clean]
					[CDI:USAGE_HINT:CLEAN_SELF]
					[CDI:USAGE_HINT:CLEAN_FRIEND]
					[CDI:BP_REQUIRED:BY_CATEGORY:TONGUE]
					[CDI:VERB:lick:licks:lick each other]
					[CDI:CAN_BE_MUTUAL] <-- not yet implemented
					[CDI:TARGET:A:SELF_ALLOWED:TOUCHABLE] <-- so the animal can lick themselves or anybody nearby
					[CDI:TARGET_RANGE:A:1]
					[CDI:MAX_TARGET_NUMBER:A:1]
					[CDI:WAIT_PERIOD:10]
```

TITLE: Configuring Window and Performance Settings in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: These settings control window behavior and performance display options. TOPMOST keeps the window on top of others, FPS enables a frame rate counter, and FPS_CAP/G_FPS_CAP set maximum gameplay and graphical frame rates respectively.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/data/init/init.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
[TOPMOST:NO]
[FPS:NO]
[FPS_CAP:100]
[G_FPS_CAP:50]
```

TITLE: Using Context Tokens in Dwarf Fortress Text Generation
DESCRIPTION: Example of how Dwarf Fortress uses special tokens to insert dynamic content into text strings. The tokens CONTEXT:HIST_FIG:TRANS_NAME, CONTEXT:SITE:TRANS_NAME, and CONTEXT:ABSTRACT_BUILDING:TRANS_NAME are placeholders that the game will replace with the translated names of specific historical figures, sites, and buildings respectively.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/data/speech/same_site_ab_specific_hf_seeker.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
seek out [CONTEXT:HIST_FIG:TRANS_NAME] here in [CONTEXT:SITE:TRANS_NAME] at [CONTEXT:ABSTRACT_BUILDING:TRANS_NAME]
```

TITLE: Defining Announcement Flag Options in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This section explains the available flags that can be applied to announcements in Dwarf Fortress. These flags control how and where announcements are displayed and whether they cause game interruptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/data/init/announcements.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: configuration
CODE:
```
BOX or DO_MEGA: the announcment will appear in a box and pause the game
P or PAUSE: the announcement will cause the game to pause
R or RECENTER: the announcement will cause the game to recenter (if possible)
A_D or A_DISPLAY: the announcement will be displayed in the main adventure announcement log (and on screen)
D_D or D_DISPLAY: the announcement will be displayed in the main dwarf announcement log (and at the bottom)
UCR or UNIT_COMBAT_REPORT: the announcement will be associated to the unit combat/hunting/sparring reports
UCR_A or UNIT_COMBAT_REPORT_ALL_ACTIVE: the announcement will be associated to any active unit combat/hunting/sparring reports, but if there are no reports it will not create one
```

TITLE: Define Summon Unit Interaction in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines an interaction for summoning a unit (bogeyman) to a random nearby location. It specifies the target locations (A and B), the type of creature to summon (NIGHT_CREATURE_BOGEYMAN), and a time range for the summoning effect. It highlights the usage of IE_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/interaction_secret.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw Syntax
CODE:
```
"[INTERACTION:EXAMPLE SUMMON]
\t[I_TARGET:A:LOCATION]
\t\t[IT_LOCATION:CONTEXT_LOCATION]
\t[I_TARGET:B:LOCATION]
\t\t[IT_LOCATION:RANDOM_NEARBY_LOCATION:A:5]
\t[I_EFFECT:SUMMON_UNIT]
\t\t[IE_TARGET:B]
\t\t[IE_IMMEDIATE]
\t\t[IE_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:NIGHT_CREATURE_BOGEYMAN]
\t\tAlso available: IE_CREATURE_FLAG, IE_FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_FLAG, IE_FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG
\t\t[IE_TIME_RANGE:200:300]"

```

TITLE: Defining new world generation parameters in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines new world generation parameters in Dwarf Fortress to control the number of sites and megabeasts.  `SITE_CAP` limits the total number of sites (caves and ruins), while `MEGABEAST_CAP` sets the maximum number of megabeast groups and `SEMIMEGABEAST_CAP` controls the number of semimegabeast groups.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/file changes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
	New world gen parameters
		[SITE_CAP:<number>]
			Limits overall number of sites to this.
			Caves and ruins are included in this number, so world gen civ spread stops cold once it is attained the way things currently go.

		[MEGABEAST_CAP:<number>]
			Attempts to place this many megabeast groups (also effectively capped by total cave number).
			In vanilla DF, there are no megabeasts that actually occur in groups, but it is possible in mods.
			Placing more beasts than caves will cause all caves to be filled by megabeasts.  This will leave nothing for races like kobolds.
			Can be zero if you don't want any megabeasts.

		[SEMIMEGABEAST_CAP:<number>]
			Attempts to place this many semimegabeast groups (they get the last cave remnants).
			Because they get the last available caves, setting this to maximum causes all remaining caves to be filled with civs unaffected.
			Can be zero if you don't want any semimegabeasts.
```

TITLE: Defining Giant Gila Monster
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the Giant Gila Monster by copying from the base Gila Monster and then applying creature variations to make it gigantic. It converts specific tags like STATE_NAME and SYN_NAME to reflect its giant status, removes the default size modifiers, and then applies a new size modifier to drastically increase its size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_desert_new.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_7

	[CV_CONVERT_TAG]
		[CVCT_MASTER:STATE_NAME]
		[CVCT_TARGET:gila monster]
		[CVCT_REPLACEMENT:giant gila monster]
	[CV_CONVERT_TAG]
		[CVCT_MASTER:STATE_ADJ]
		[CVCT_TARGET:gila monster]
		[CVCT_REPLACEMENT:giant gila monster]
	[CV_CONVERT_TAG]
		[CVCT_MASTER:SYN_NAME]
		[CVCT_TARGET:gila monster]
		[CVCT_REPLACEMENT:giant gila monster]
	[CV_CONVERT_TAG]
		[CVCT_MASTER:SYN_IMMUNE_CREATURE]
		[CVCT_TARGET:GILA_MONSTER]
		[CVCT_REPLACEMENT:GIANT_GILA_MONSTER]
	[APPLY_CURRENT_CREATURE_VARIATION]
	[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:GIANT]
	[CV_REMOVE_TAG:CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC]
	[APPLY_CURRENT_CREATURE_VARIATION]
	[GO_TO_END]
	[SELECT_CASTE:ALL]
	[CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC:10701]
	[GO_TO_START]

	[CASTE_NAME:giant gila monster:giant gila monsters:giant gila monster]

TITLE: Adding new body part tag in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet introduces a new body part tag in Dwarf Fortress, `CONNECTOR`, which governs how body parts are severed.  When a child part with CONNECTOR is severed, its parent part remains connected unless it also receives severing damage.  This changes how damage propagation affects body structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/file changes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
	new bp tag
		CONNECTOR -- child part with CONNECTOR keeps parent unsevered until receiving severing damage itself
```

TITLE: Configuring Dwarf Fortress Init Options
DESCRIPTION: These init options control various gameplay and interface settings in Dwarf Fortress. They can be added to the init.txt file to customize the game experience.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/file changes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
[VOLUME:255]
[TOPMOST:NO]
[SHOW_IMP_QUALITY:YES]
[SHOW_FLOW_AMOUNTS:NO]
[ECONOMY:YES]
[INVADERS:YES]
[CAVEINS:YES]
[ARTIFACTS:YES]
[PATH_COST:1:2:5:25]
[COFFIN_NO_PETS_DEFAULT:NO]
[RECENTER_INTERFACE_SHUTDOWN_MS:0]
[SKY:178:3:0:0]
[SKY:250:0:0:1]
[VSYNC:OFF]
[G_FPS_CAP:50]
[AUTOSAVE:NONE]
[AUTOBACKUP:NO]
[INITIAL_SAVE:NO]
[ADVENTURER_ALWAYS_CENTER:YES]
[PAUSE_ON_LOAD:NO]
[EMBARK_RECTANGLE:6:6]
[PRIORITY:NORMAL]
[ZERO_RENT:NO]
[BABY_CHILD_CAP:100:1000]
```

TITLE: Defining an Item Tool (Drum Body) in Dwarf Fortress RAW
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the raw properties of an item tool for a drum body. TITLE: Listing New Features in Dwarf Fortress 0.44.12
DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive list of new features added in Dwarf Fortress version 0.44.12, including changes to fortress mode, adventure mode, world generation, and various game mechanics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/release notes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
New stuff
	(*) Guilds organize and petition for guildhalls, guild members can do skill demonstrations
	(*) Members of organized religions can petition for temples and priesthood recognition, priests give sermons and comfort stressed dwarves
	(*) Traitor dwarves, artifact heists, interrogation for crime from the justice screen, counterintelligence readout with organization charts
	(*) Most aquifers are much slower filling
	(*) Can start with a party in adventure mode
	(*) Specify background and starting location and beliefs in adventure mode (most labor skills still meaningless)
	(*) Can start with specified equipment and pets in adventure mode
	(*) Tactical combat mode for adventurer party
	(*) Adventurer can ride mounts, place items on pack animals, lead animals, claim pets, gift pets, and name pets (rider skill matters for melee/ranged rolls currently)
	(*) Can pet animals in adventure mode
	(*) Addition mood information in adventure mode conversations, (simple) interrogation options, flattery, joke-telling, calming remarks, (very simple) sermons
	(*) Simple intrigue display with actors and charts discovered in interrogation in adventure mode (in 'Q')
	(*) Divination shrines with dice and various effects
	(*) Lots of new intermediate positions (mostly without new mechanics) in entities (chamberlains etc.)
	(*) Alliances against world-ending threats in world generation
	(*) Various villainous activity in world generation, in play off-site, and (more limited) in fort mode, world generation surveillance, interrogation and punishment.  Historical plots include theft, sabotage, abduction, assassination, coups, corrupt advancement promises, embezzlement, starting wars, and framing enemies.
	(*) Romantic relationship changes (multiple lovers, affairs, children outside marriage, divorces, etc.) as well as other relationship changes and details (friendship/rival types, variables like trust, respect and loyalty)
	(*) Merchant companies, military orders and mercenary companies, craft guilds in world generation
	(*) Individual mercenaries and companies can upgrade their equipment, and richer world gen people can purchase houses and build up their own city towers
	(*) Various religious interactions (shrine building, sermons, persecution) in world generation, lots of religious demographics tracking which influences shrine creation, religious sites and sermons influencing membership numbers, holy cities and a few levels of priest
	(*) Various horrifying new necromancer/mummy/demon/vampire etc. matter - snow-balling zombie invasions, multiple experiment types, intelligent undead lieutenants with new powers, nightmarish summons, spreading evil zones, promises of immortality in villainous plots
	(*) Dwarves can trigger dig-deep disasters in world generation, with repercussions coming to other sites, including fort mode
	(*) Some new locations, some map details still in-progress, monasteries, private city towers, guildhalls, merchant counting houses, forts (bandits and mercenaries), castles have returned (basically unchanged), better necromancer towers and simple outlying buildings
```

TITLE: Setting Color Attributes and Material Value in Dwarf Fortress Creature
DESCRIPTION: Configures color attributes for feathers, skin, and eyes across all castes. Also multiplies the material value of all creature materials by 15, affecting trade and butchering returns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_standard.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_107

LANGUAGE: dwarf-fortress-raw
CODE:
```
[SELECT_CASTE:ALL]
	[SET_TL_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:ALL:FEATHER]
		[TL_COLOR_MODIFIER:WHITE:1]
			[TLCM_NOUN:feathers:PLURAL]
	[SET_TL_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:ALL:SKIN]
		[TL_COLOR_MODIFIER:BLACK:1]
			[TLCM_NOUN:skin:SINGULAR]
	[SET_TL_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:EYE:EYE]
		[TL_COLOR_MODIFIER:BLACK:1]
			[TLCM_NOUN:eyes:PLURAL]
[SELECT_MATERIAL:ALL]
	[MULTIPLY_VALUE:15]
```

TITLE: Defining Pipe Opal Gem Properties in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: Organizes pipe opal details emphasizing high-value gem characteristics and its utilitarian ivory state within opal group selections for strategic deployment.

CODE:
```
[INORGANIC:PIPE OPAL]
[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:STONE_TEMPLATE]
[MATERIAL_VALUE:10][DISPLAY_COLOR:7:7:1][TILE:15][IS_GEM:pipe opal:STP:OVERWRITE_SOLID]
[ENVIRONMENT:ALL_STONE:CLUSTER_SMALL:10]
[SOLID_DENSITY:2115]  Common to opals.  Range is 1980 - 2250
[STATE_COLOR:ALL_SOLID:IVORY]
```

TITLE: Defining Inorganic Sandy Clay in DF Modding
DESCRIPTION: The snippet specifies sandy clay with its state, display parameters, and density in the context of Dwarf Fortress modding. Sandy clay is composed of 55% sand, 40% clay, and 5% silt, with a solid density of 1330 and is easily modifiable to form ceramic earthenware.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/inorganic_stone_soil.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

[STATE_NAME_ADJ:ALL_SOLID:sandy clay][DISPLAY_COLOR:4:6:0][TILE:177]
[SOIL]
[SOLID_DENSITY:1330] SCS = 55/40/5
[MATERIAL_REACTION_PRODUCT:FIRED_MAT:INORGANIC:CERAMIC_EARTHENWARE]
```

TITLE: Red-winged Blackbird Base Creature Definition
DESCRIPTION: Configures the base creature template for red-winged blackbirds including biome preferences, behaviors and physical attributes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_birds.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: raw
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:BIRD_RW_BLACKBIRD]
	[DESCRIPTION:A small black bird with bright red markings under the wings. They live in the marshland.]
	[NAME:red-winged blackbird:red-winged blackbirds:red-winged blackbird]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Item Interaction Keybindings
DESCRIPTION: This section defines keybindings for interacting with items, including viewing descriptions, forbidding, melting, dumping, and hiding. These commands allow the player to manage inventory and control the availability of resources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/data/init/interface.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
"[ITEM_DESCRIPTION:V]
[ITEM_FORBID:F]
[ITEM_MELT:M]
[ITEM_DUMP:D]
[ITEM_HIDE:H]"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Color Pattern for Iris Eye in Yellow
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the 'IRIS_EYE_YELLOW' pattern using colors WHITE, BLACK, and YELLOW, facilitating another visual option for players creating characters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/descriptor_pattern_iris_eye.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
[COLOR_PATTERN:IRIS_EYE_YELLOW]
	[PATTERN:IRIS_EYE]
	[CP_COLOR:WHITE]
	[CP_COLOR:BLACK]
	[CP_COLOR:YELLOW]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Giant Chinchilla Characteristics - Dwarf Fortress - Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: Describes the giant chinchilla creature, inherits tags from the chinchilla, adjusts body size percentage, and sets specific attributes such as population, cluster number, appearance, and functionality as a pet and mount. Includes speed behaviors for different gaits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_mountain_new.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:GIANT_CHINCHILLA]
[COPY_TAGS_FROM:CHINCHILLA]
[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:GIANT]
[CV_REMOVE_TAG:CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC]
[APPLY_CURRENT_CREATURE_VARIATION]
[GO_TO_END]
[SELECT_CASTE:ALL]
[CHANGE_BODY_SIZE_PERC:40700]
[GO_TO_START]
[NAME:giant chinchilla:giant chinchillas:giant chinchilla]
[CASTE_NAME:giant chinchilla:giant chinchillas:giant chinchilla]
[GENERAL_CHILD_NAME:giant chinchilla kit:giant chinchilla kits]
[DESCRIPTION:A large monster in the shape of a chinchilla.]
[POPULATION_NUMBER:15:30]
[CLUSTER_NUMBER:3:5]
[CREATURE_TILE:'C']
[COLOR:7:0:0]
[PET_EXOTIC]
[PETVALUE:500]
[MOUNT_EXOTIC]
[GO_TO_END]
[PREFSTRING:fur]
[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_QUADRUPED_GAITS:900:657:438:219:1900:2900] 40 kph
[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_SWIMMING_GAITS:2990:2257:1525:731:4300:6100] 12 kph
[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:STANDARD_CRAWLING_GAITS:2990:2257:1525:731:4300:6100] 12 kph
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Mouse and Display Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Configuration options for mouse control, display settings and interface customization added across versions 0.21.104.21a-19a.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/file changes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
[MOUSE:YES]
[MOUSE_PICTURE:NO]
[ENGRAVINGS_START_OBSCURED:NO]
[WINDOWED:PROMPT]
[NICKNAME_DWARF:REPLACE_FIRST]
[NICKNAME_ADVENTURE:REPLACE_FIRST]
[NICKNAME_LEGENDS:REPLACE_FIRST]
```

TITLE: Example of Dwarf Fortress World Generation with Specific Seed
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to use the command line to generate a Dwarf Fortress world with a specific ID, seed, and world generation parameter.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/command line.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
EXAMPLE:	"Dwarf Fortress.exe" -gen 1 3498 "MEDIUM ISLAND"
```

TITLE: Configuring Hippo Man Creature Variant
DESCRIPTION: Anthropomorphic hippo creature variant with bipedal movement and human-like attributes while preserving core hippo characteristics
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_large_riverlake.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dfhack
CODE:
```
[CREATURE:HIPPO_MAN]
	[COPY_TAGS_FROM:HIPPO]
	[APPLY_CREATURE_VARIATION:ANIMAL_PERSON]
```

TITLE: Defining Machine and Siege Engine Hotkeys
DESCRIPTION: This section defines hotkeys specifically for building machines and siege engines within Dwarf Fortress. It encompasses water wheels, windmills, gear assemblies, axles, rollers, ballistae, and catapults.  These controls facilitate construction and operation of complex mechanical devices and siege weaponry.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/data/init/interface.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
"[HOTKEY_BUILDING_MACHINE_SCREW_PUMP:S]
[HOTKEY_BUILDING_MACHINE_WATER_WHEEL:W]
[HOTKEY_BUILDING_MACHINE_WINDMILL:M]
[HOTKEY_BUILDING_MACHINE_GEAR_ASSEMBLY:G]
[HOTKEY_BUILDING_MACHINE_AXLE_HORIZONTAL:H]
[HOTKEY_BUILDING_MACHINE_AXLE_VERTICAL:V]
[HOTKEY_BUILDING_MACHINE_ROLLERS:R]
[HOTKEY_BUILDING_SIEGEENGINE_BALLISTA:B]
[HOTKEY_BUILDING_SIEGEENGINE_CATAPULT:C]"

[USE_MATERIAL_TEMPLATE:STONE_TEMPLATE]

TITLE: Defining Giant Ostrich in Dwarf Fortress

TITLE: Defining Animal Curse Interaction in Dwarf Fortress
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines an animal curse interaction in Dwarf Fortress. The source is a deity, and the target is a creature. The effect adds a syndrome that transforms the target into an animal for one week, applying various creature caste and flag restrictions to ensure a natural animal transformation. It also prevents aging, eating, and drinking during the curse's duration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/interaction examples/example - shrine effects.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw
CODE:
```
"[INTERACTION:ANIMAL_CURSE]\n\t[I_SOURCE:DEITY]\n\t	[IS_USAGE_HINT:MEDIUM_CURSE]\n\t	[IS_TRIGGER_STRING_SECOND:have]\n\t	[IS_TRIGGER_STRING_THIRD:has]\n\t	[IS_TRIGGER_STRING:been cursed, for one week, to know life as a beast!]\n\t[I_TARGET:A:CREATURE]\n\t	[IT_LOCATION:CONTEXT_CREATURE]\n\t	[IT_MANUAL_INPUT:victim]\n\t[I_EFFECT:ADD_SYNDROME]\n\t	[IE_TARGET:A]\n\t	[IE_IMMEDIATE]\n\t	[SYNDROME]\n\t		[SYN_CONCENTRATION_ADDED:1000:0]\n\t		[CE_BODY_TRANSFORMATION:START:0:PEAK:0:END:8400:ABRUPT]\n\t			[CE:CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:NATURAL_ANIMAL]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_FLAG:SMALL_RACE]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:LARGE_PREDATOR]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:CANNOT_BREATHE_AIR]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:IMMOBILE_LAND]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:CAN_LEARN]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:MEGABEAST]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:SEMIMEGABEAST]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:TITAN]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:DEMON]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:UNIQUE_DEMON]\n\t			[CE:FORBIDDEN_CREATURE_CASTE_FLAG:SUPERNATURAL]\n\t			[CE:HAVE_FAST_EFFORTLESS_GAIT_SPEED:1000]\n\t		[CE_ADD_TAG:NO_AGING:NO_EAT:NO_DRINK:START:0:PEAK:0:END:8400:ABRUPT]"

TITLE: Defining Head Hair Tissue Layers in DFScript
DESCRIPTION: The snippet defines how head hair tissues are layered on creatures, specifically those with a body part categorized as HEAD. This requires tissues and body part categories to be predefined. The layering is described with tokens and thickness values and results in a detailed anatomical structure for head hair.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/b_detail_plan_default.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: DFScript
CODE:
```
[BODY_DETAIL_PLAN:HEAD_HAIR_TISSUE_LAYERS]
This command creates tissue layers using tissue token HAIR on every bodypart that has category HEAD.  Categories are strings you type up in the bodypart raws.  The number is a thickness.  You can also place a position or relation token after the thickness, but it isn\'t required.  You can put multiple tissue layers in each command.  Each one starts with a group token (BY_CATEGORY, BY_TYPE, BY_TOKEN).
[BP_LAYERS:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:HAIR:1:TOP]
[BP_LAYERS:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:HAIR:1:BACK]
```

DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines hair growth parameters for creatures, setting the length, growth rate, and description ranges for various types of facial and head hair.
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/raw/objects/creature_standard.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_76

LANGUAGE: Dwarf Fortress Raw
CODE:
```
[SET_TL_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:HAIR]
 [PLUS_TL_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:CHEEK_WHISKERS]
 [PLUS_TL_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:CHIN_WHISKERS]
 [PLUS_TL_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:MOUSTACHE]
 [PLUS_TL_GROUP:BY_CATEGORY:HEAD:SIDEBURNS]
	[TISSUE_LAYER_APPEARANCE_MODIFIER:LENGTH:0:0:0:0:0:0:0]
		[APP_MOD_RATE:1:DAILY:0:1000:0:0:NO_END]
		[APP_MOD_NOUN:hair:SINGULAR]
		[APP_MOD_DESC_RANGE:10:25:75:125:200:300]
```

TITLE: Initialization Configuration for Visitors and Invasions
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for setting population caps for visitors, soldier invasions, and monster invasions in d_init
SOURCE: https://github.com/qartar/dwarf-fortress/blob/legacy/file changes.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: dwarf fortress raw
CODE:
```
[VISITOR_CAP:100]
[INVASION_SOLDIER_CAP:120]
[INVASION_MONSTER_CAP:40]
```
